docs.lead_paragraph: The Russian artist ZACHAROFF, living at St. Petersburg, lately made a picture, which represents PETER I. in his workshop, where he is making a cross. In order to connect the ride Enperor with the late reigning monarch, a clever motto was written at the foot of the pictutre. which was then sunmitted to the Emperor for his approbation, provious to its engraved and distributed in prints.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Dr. Hunter on the Complications of Consumption, and on the Means by which Disease of the Lungs is Detected.

docs.lead_paragraph: LETTER NO. XV. To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: SlR: Consumption is often mistaken for other diseases. Although its destroying influence is confined to the lungs, the sympathetic complications to which it gives rise are frequently or such severity, and produce so much distress in other organs, as to load to grievous mistakes and errors in treatment.

The New Steamboat Commonwealth.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have been iavored with a dozen copies of an exceedingly pompous programme announcing the opening of the Italian Opera season at Niblo's Garden, on Monday evening, April 30. The artistes appear to consist entirely of Madame La Baronesse DE LAGRANGE, who, we presume, will be the prima donna and the company also.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last evening an interesting exposition took place at the Ward School No. 31, Monroe,street, of a novel system, in which the oliatonic musical ?cale, as applied to the correct sound of the vowels, in connection with consonants, is easily and usefully made the elementary mode of school tuition. Mr. SCHUYLER CLARK, expositor of this mode, thinks it applicable to our primary schools.
